docs.lead_paragraph: CAROL SILVERMAN paced the floor of the big, white, airy room, tweaking a posture here, walking her fingers down a spine there. Incense burned in the corner, and floor-to-ceiling windows framed the Hudson River, which glinted under a pale winter sky. ''Is your forehead smooth?'' she asked the students, arrayed on blue mat. ''Be your own therapist. Be present. Relax the neck.''
docs.abstract: Article on crop of yoga studios and yoga classes at gyms and health clubs that have sprung up in Westchester County, NY, in recent years; focuses on scene at Yoga Zone in Irvington, NY; photos (M)
